content.description: The mean number of sick days per employee taken last year by all employees of a large city was 10.6 days. A city administrator is investigating whether the mean number of sick days this year is different from the mean number of sick days last year. The administrator takes a random sample of 40 employees and finds the mean of the sample to be 12.9. A hypothesis test will be conducted as part of the investigation.
content.question: Which of the following is the correct set of hypotheses?

choices.label: <math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 10.6. H sub a: mu is greater than 10.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10.6</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>></mo><mn>10.6</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 10.6. H sub a: mu is not equal to 10.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10.6</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>10.6</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 10.6. H sub a: mu is less than 10.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10.6</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>10.6</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 12.9. H sub a: mu is not equal to 12.9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12.9</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>12.9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 12.9. H sub a: mu is less than 12.9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12.9</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>12.9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 10.6. H sub a: mu is not equal to 10.6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10.6</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>10.6</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
